reviewText:
Star Wars Battlefront II is one of my favorite shooters I have played in my life. It trumps Call of Duty, and even Battlefield, in my opinion. It will evoke the classic feeling of Star Wars inside of you, whether you're a new fan or an old one. The game is hilariously unbalanced and the AI is very broken at times, but the childlike wonder of being a jedi or being a stormtrooper almost always shields that from my sight. The space dogfights are awesome once you get the hang of them as well, and it's also very fun to infiltrate enemy ships and blow them up from the inside.

All in all, if I had to give it a rating I'd give this game a 9/10. It's definitely worth it's small pricetag.

TO ANYONE WHO CAN NOT CONTACT KEY SERVER - I suggest opening a Steam support ticket. They should be able to help.

reviewText:
“When 900 years old, you reach… Look as good, you will not.” -Master YodaStar Wars Battlefront II, beginning as a mod for the acclaimed Battlefield series and later attaining its own featured release, has been, is, and always will be one of my favorite games. While writing this review, I was at a loss for words in regards to the overabundance of joy that this game has brought me through the years, and I can proudly say that I own every variance of this game, including the PC, Playstation 2, and Xbox versions. Overall, I have spent more time playing this game than any other game in my library, which includes a massive set of classics such as the Jak & Daxter series, 007 Goldeneye, the Sonic the Hedgehog collection, and even the Pokemon franchise, which I have solely worked over hundreds of hours of play! I apologize that this review may not be as professional, and will be more of a fan’s remembrance to this awesome game. Before I begin, I would like to give a special thanks to some good friends-one being Lime Dorito-that put up with pre-reading this review, as well as my brother, Matthew, for playing countless hours of this game with me on the other ports.
Here are some things that I love about Star Wars Battlefront II:

Gameplay - Star Wars Battlefront II is a war game, plain and simple. There are about six classes to choose from in each of the respective four armies, and playable Heroes such as Luke Skywalker and Boba Fett are available. This title also allows players to engage in vehicular combat, even hosting maps for dogfights in space against two rivalling fleets. Described earlier, there are several game modes similar to that of the Battlefield games, though Battlefront II has a unique game mode known as Assault, where Heroes from both the Good and Evil spectrums of the Star Wars films battle against each other. Overall, the game balances very well between aerial and ground combat, and evolves into a truly unique experience over multiplayer; unfortunately, the company that originally hosted the dedicated servers for Battlefront II, GameSpy is no longer operational, so other means of multiplayer is required on the PC port.

Game Modes - In Campaign Mode, you mirror the Star Wars trilogy while playing as this group of soldiers as they influence the structure of the story that fans of only the movies know and love; this concept is similar to Star Wars Dark Forces in which the character Kyle Katarn is the one who was said to steal the Death Star plans for the Rebellion. Unlike the other Star Wars games such as Bounty Hunter and Dark Forces, Battlefront II maintains a focus on a specific group of Stormtroopers-rather than a single individual-infamously known by fans of the extended universe as the 501st, or Vader’s Fist. The Campaign introduces gameplay unique to the rest of the game in that it is objective-based, contrary to the usual skirmishes. For example, instead of a player dropping into a battlefield without an pretense as to what to do and why they’re fighting, the player is briefed on the purpose of the mission beforehand to perform a specific task such as protecting a Command Post for a given amount of time, or to locate a driver for a downed AT-AT that requires services.
///  Galactic Conquest Mode is a change of pace, as players strategically maneuver battleships across a large map in an attempt to overtake all territories. This game mode features out-of-battle unit purchasing as well as upgrades that allow the player to determine how they want to progress in an all-out war  against a rivaling army; the opposing force depends on which era of the Star Wars universe you are in, and pits either the CIS against Clone Troopers or the Empire versus the Rebellion.
///  Don’t want to worry about progressing through the story in Campaign Mode or strategically planning your way through Galactic Conquest? Give Instant Action Mode a go! Skirmish is exactly what it sounds like: you pick the game mode you want to play-between Conquest, Hunt, 1- and 2-Flag CTF, Space Assault, Assault, and Space 1-Flag CTF-and go from there. There are various settings for each, as well as playable Jedi/Heroes.

Class System - Like Battlefield, this title has multiple unique classes that operate differently. Every class has their own unique appearance, primary and secondary weapons, statistics, and secondary equipment. For example, the Engineer class is much quicker due to his primary weapon being a shotgun. This class has a low rate of fire and a quick land speed, and is meant to splice into or repair vehicles with their Fusioncutters; it is played like a support class in most instances, but can easily clear singular enemies without a problem. The Engineer is also equipped with Detpacks-which are detonated remotely-and health and ammo dispensers.

TL:DR - I had planned to write about weapon similarities between this game and the movies, as well as other topics, but if I had to talk about everything that is good about this game I would be typing for days. As you can tell from the above quote and through each of the screenshots, the Battlefront series does not look as polished in comparison to modern titles. However, this is just one of those games that stands the test of time with its amazing feel and fanatical impression. If you are a Star Wars fan, this title should not be passed up; if you are a Star Wars Battlefront fan, this installment to the series will not be forgotten. Thanks for reading.

Do you enjoy these reviews? Please visit my Curator Page at  Spearpoint Reviews	.

reviewText:
It is easy to rip on the Star Wars prequels. You can picket and cry foul that Lucas betrayed your childhood and that he turned a once revolutionary film series into a sameless Disney style toy template (Oh the irony). However, you should consider all the good it has brought as well. Cool music from John Williams, double lightsabers, awesome new spacecraft and Video Games.

Amongst the heaps of shovelware Lucasarts published during the prequel frenzy there were a bunch of amazing gems. Like Episode One Racer, Knights of the Old Republic, Battle for Naboo, Galactic Battlegrounds and eventually: Battlefront. Based off the Battlefield: 1942 concept, Battlefront allowed players to experience the battles of both the prequels and originals from the perspective of the ordinary stormtrooper or battledroid. It was amazing, but was not enough.

Enter Battlefront 2, the bigger, better and more amazing version of an already amazing game. Fear the day when stormtroopers suddenly learn how to shoot, because that is when you're really playing this game.
In general, the game is split in two different modes: Single and Mulitplayer. In singleplayer you play the tour of duty of the 501st Legion of the clone army, who after defeating the seperatist droid army become the elite troopers under the command of Darth Vader. The whole campaign is a short sequence with random objectives, but the whole is narrated by Temuera Morrison, the actor for Jango Fett and every Clone trooper ever. It adds some legitimacy to the whole romp. The other major single player mode is Galactic Conquest. It is a large scale turn based tactics game where you try to manouver your fleet with troops around the galaxy and subjugate (or liberate, if you're into that sort of thing; you tree sniffing hippie). You can employ bonusses, granted to you by owning certain planets.

On the other hand of the spectum is multiplayer; and this is the reason why we're here. Allowing 64 peeps to take to the field at the same time...that's real warfare. This game was at the frontline of modern FPS development. You'll see many mainstays of modern shooters make their debut here, such as endurance rewards, killstreak rewards and other unlockable perks. Most destructive of the lot are the Jedi units. The ultimate streak reward gives you access one of the saga's heroes and elevates your lowly soldier rank to harbinger of death with a lightsaber. The sheer terror, characters like Darth Maul and Mace Windu inspire is amazing as they cut through swathes of troops.

The real selling point though are the maps. The maps are open and wide to accomodate the massive amount of players. However, each map has a lot of secret passages and corridors that allow for exploration and experimentation. On top of that, the level of detail is amazing. Intricate care was taken to make all the maps look like they came right off the movie screen. You can run around the death star, from the hangar with the falcon, into the prison block, jump into the grabage shute, fight through the barracs, blow up the main laser, pace past the tractor beam generator, kick over the conference table where Vader expressed his opinion about a lack of faith and finally back to the hangar, all in one level.
Along side are the space battle stages. These battles are big, point based levels where you take to the stars in fighters, bombers and boarding craft. You either earn points by shooting down other fighters in dogfights or bomb their capital ships to bits, or you board them and start sabotaging their internal systems. It's a sweet change of pace, although it can be hassle to fly without a gamepad.

It's therefore a shame the game's description on the Steam store reads that all online functionality in dead as of this year's May. Which is pure bantha poodoo. You still get around with some trickery. Even better, at this pricepoint, you might just better off telling all your friends to just buy it and bring their laptop over (it's old enough to run on any potato at this point), and just host a massive LAN party to restore balance to Force once and for all.

reviewText: 30 CIS troops, me as one of them. 50 clones, holding more control points than us. My droideka rolls forward and unfolds, shields up and running in seconds. 5 seconds later, 5 clones lay dead before me, and a yellow message appears. 'Darth Maul is ready to activate'.... 2 minutes later, Darth Maul dies, along with 35 clones troops. I quickly go back to my droideka, and head towards an enemy command post. All 4 clones stand there, one in a turret. I gun my way through 3 of them, and land a lucky headshot on the trooper inside the turret. A red flash appears on the mini map; the final enemy. I fold back up and race towards it. I hear gunfire, but not directed at me. I see the clone. But he's different. His helmet has a mask on. I zoom in using my enhanced optical sensors. It's a clone sharpshooter. And he's wearing a troll face mask. He shoots, killing a droid engineer in the far distance, before a DEFEAT screen appears in front of me. *raises blaster to head*\n\n10/10 would kill-self again.

reviewText:
NOTE 1: The game is OLD, being released back in 2005 so most likely than not you will encounter compatibility issues. I feel the need to point this out since it is not the game's fault that its 9 years old. There are 3 possible solutions to this:

1. Right Click Battlefront 2 on Steam > Properties > Local Files > Browse Local Files, this will open the Battlefront 2 folder, Open GameData > Right click 'Battlefront II.exe' > Properties > Compatibility > Check 'Run this program in Compatibility for: Windows XP SP2.

2. Plug in a microphone to your microphone jack, people on the forums report that this actually (usually) work.

3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwR1i3tMCqA (Follow the instructions on this video, this worked for me).

NOTE 2: The game supports 1080p resolution. Only the main menu, loading screens and pre-rendered cinematic are low resolution. The game itself, once you get it running, runs at a pristine 1080p, 60fps.

INTRODUCTION:Star Wars: Battefront 2 is a first / third-person shooter game by LucasArts involving Star Wars' (duh) different histories ranging from the start of the Clone Wars towards Empire Strikes Back. It features soldier classes, hero characters, galactic conquest and a particularly fun space battle.

The campaign follows the rough history of the 501st Clone/Stormtrooper Legion, Darth Vader's personal bodyguards and elite fighting force. As already stated, this will involve the events of Episode II: Clone Wars, up until Episode V: Empire Strikes back.

PROS:+ Graphics aged well: - The old Pandemic Zero Engine is showing it's age but is not about to go down without a fight. Animation Quality is fluid, character models are well made, texture quality are very good for its time.

+ Relatively Strong Campaign: - Short but satisfying is what I would describe the campaign. Voiced by none other than Temuera Morrison (Jango Fett), it delivers the exploits of the 501st Legion in a very informative and fun experience. Unfortunately the maps are only multilayer maps with given objectives.

+ Space Battle: - Nothing beats the excitement of piloting different kinds of fighters and bombers to attack key points on the enemy battleship or engage in open space dogfights. If that’s not your thing, then land your fighter (or a transport ship) in the enemy Hanger area and start wreaking havoc with the ship's internal systems. Or just steal an enemy fighter.

CONS:- AI is too easy: - Way to easy once you get a hang of it even when fighting 'Elite' difficulty AI.

- Campaign is too short: - Given that I already played it back in the day, it took me at least 4-5 hours to finish the story mode.

- Hilariously Imbalanced in some places: - Not game-breaking by any stretch, but the game does lack the rock, paper, scissors element that usually balances out multiplayer games. Some of the maps tend to favor one particular faction than the other.

- AI is annoyingly dumb: - Especially in space battles. I get that you're a Stormtrooper and can't shoot to save your life, but standing around the hanger just staring at the wall instead of boarding a fighter and helping me fend off the millions of rebel fighters bearing down on us is a whole new level of incompetence.

CONCLUSION:GREAT GAME and lots of FUN. The PROS definitely outweigh the CONS and that it provides a cure for that need for a casual fast paced action game. The single player experience is enough to keep you satisfied if you lack the online capabilities or when GameSpy inevitably shuts down.

We can just hope that EA handles the franchise with care as the sequel for this game is already way overdue.

---------------------------------------------------------

Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)

reviewText:
I think the most efficient way to review this would be a non (slightly) biased comparison of this Battlefront (Lucas Arts / L.A) with EA's new Battlefront.

-GAMEPLAY
L.A take the lead with this one. Pretty easily to be honest. Much more game modes, maps, factions etc.. 1-0, to L.A.

-GRAPHICS
What do you expect. L.A's is 10 years old. 10 YEARS OLD. 1-1.

-REPLAYABILITY
While EA's multiplayer leveling system offer some replayability, L.A's wider range, and much larger density, of content give L.A the point. Also, and i will refer to this quite a bit, not everyone likes multiplayer. 2-1 to L.A.

-SINGLEPLAYER
EA doesn't really know how to create a good singleplayer. At all. In fact, it seems they've given up on the idea altogether. Rest in peace EA - post Battlefield 2 / Bad Company. The lack of singleplayer is a negative point for EA, and L.A's extremely well done singleplayer, including a campaign, critically acclaimed Galactic conquest, and instant action give L.A a well-deserved point. 3-0

-MULTIPLAYER
EA get a point by default, as L.A's multiplayer was decommisioned a while back. While i deducted a point from EA for not having a singleplayer, i will not do so with L.A for the lack of multiplayer as, a) there was once upon a time, and b) the expansive singleplayer more than makes up for it. There are dozens of singleplayer only games and L.A's Battlefront is one of the best. 3-1 to L.A.

-MOD SUPPORT
Time has been of L.A's side, with multitudes of mods being released, a lot of them can be considered as unofficial expansions. A conversion pack has been developed, adding the favourite instant action maps from L.A's 1st Battlefront. Who doesn't like free additional content. 4-1 to L.A.

-PRICE
L.A's Battlefront is $15 on steam (I got my copy on special for $5). Fair enough for an old game. EA's is around $80. L.A's has a LOT more content, + mods such as the conversion pack. 1/5 of the price for (in my opinion) a much better game. 5-1.

-ACCESSABILITY
I can run L.A's Battlefront with 128 bots, maxed settings, easily over 60 fps, on my laptop. While L.A's Battlefront is only available on steam, Xbox + Xbox 360, and PS2, EA's is only available on the newer platforms (so tough luck for fellow laptop users). Also, for console users, EA's is multiplayer only (effectively) so hooray for online costs. Close battle, but point to L.A. 6-1.

OVERRALL
If this was a football match, L.A's Battlefront would be Barcelona, and EA's would be Norwich. EA has yet again disappointed with its money-mongering and lack of singleplayer ability. I'm pretty sure EA have just produced the 1st clickbait-like game, not sure why they didn't call it Battlefield: Star Wars and save the royalty costs. Congrats to L.A's Battlefront for beating a game 10 years newer,

reviewText:
Returned my DICE copy of Battlefie- er front. I wish that EA had not become the monster that controls the gaming world. I wish we could go back in time when you would buy an entire game upfront for one price. Or when you could play alone and escape the competitive moshpit of DICE/CoD games.

My heart was broken when I played BattlefieldDICE... Like when my dog died but with more anger and resentment, even a little depression cause I'm passionate about the gaming life and it seems that only corruption remains in the industry. How do we get people to pay us more for our game? If i wanted graphics I would watch a movie.

BF2 is the last battlefront ever made in my eyes. It's a good game made by people who really put love into the game and considered what other people might think is fun. Pandemic Studios was defunct by EA in 2009 and I will never forget or forgive that mistake.

reviewText:
This is a game I grew up with on my Playstation 2.
After seeing this was on sale here, I had to pick it up, and needless to say, I was not disappointed.
I had no idea back then as a kid that the FPS on a Playstation 2 was locked to a specific degree compared to the PC version, the game looks and feels like i'm playing an HD remix of it.
The controls are highly responsive, just like the consoles, however this is not simply a port.
All keys have been smoothly transferred over to the PC's keyboard/mouse and it feels great.
The story/career mode is just as good as i remember it being, which was simply fantastic, it's a challenge, not just some fancy map making and voice acting (Even though both are REALLY GOOD)
This is a First/Third Person shooter that you will not want to miss out on!

reviewText:
Battlefront 2 vs Battlefront 3

In Battlefront 3 can you take part in massive battles of up to 64 players? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you take part in massive battles of up to 64 players? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you take part in space battles? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you take part in space battles? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 do you have a selection of 15 playable heroes? No there is only 6.
In Battlefront 2 do you have a selection of 15 playable heroes? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you drive a wide array of vehicles? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you drive a wide array of vehicles? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you play as Yoda and slay hundreds of droids like a badass? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you play as Yoda and slay hundreds of droids like a badass? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 are there 34 playable maps? No there is 12.
In Battlefront 2 are there 34 playable maps? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you take part in battles from the clone wars? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you take part in battles from the clone wars? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you play against bots? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you play against bots? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 is there a campaign? No.
In Battlefront 2 is there a campaign? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 is there different playable classes? No.
In Battlefront 2 is there different playable classes? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you fully pilot an AT-AT? No.
In Battlefront 2 can toy fully pilot an AT-AT? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you ride Tauntauns? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you ride Tauntauns? Yes.

In Battlefront 3 can you fight in Jabba's Palace? No.
In Battlefront 2 can you fight in Jabba's Palace? Yes.

Does Battlefront 3 have DLC? Yes.
Does Battlefront 2 have DLC? No.

reviewText:
You can easily get online with GameRanger, and it works flawlessly. However, there is usually only one active server. It has on average 30-40 people online during the day and stays active till around 9-10PM (PST)
I havent noticed any server lag, nor have i seen any cheaters. But you will encounter some of both, im sure.
Pretty active for such an old game.
Definitely worth playing for a little bit at least. If not just for the nostalgia factor, the game holds up well and is a lot of fun even for someone who hasnt played before

reviewText: Quite frankly, this game was everything to me. It was fun, it had good gameplay, the story was alright, and the multiplayer was very fun. This was until June of 2014. That was when the multiplayer shut down, and I haven't played it since. Don't get me wrong, the game is still brilliant with all of its moddable content, but the multiplayer was the main focus from the get go. There are still servers on GameRangers and other places like that, but the connection and people just aren't the same, because the connection was never as good and there aren't as many people on the servers.. If you're willing to pay $10 and deal with the horrible pings from those companies, then go right ahead. If you want a good and fun campaign, you may want to go buy something like KOTOR.

reviewText:
This is the best Star Wars game of all time and I will tell you why.

First, since the 7th movie was coming out soon, I decided to start playing this game again and I just beat the campaign and played a bunch of instant action. I also played some multiplayer with GameRanger. I now think I can wright a review for this game.

We will start with the pros and cons

Pros:
-Surprisingly fun campaign: you play as the 501st clone division and soon become Vader's Fist. You play in a bunch of the iconic battles from the original series and the prequels.

-All four armies: in this game you get to play as either the clones vs. the separatists (Robots) or the Rebels vs. the Empire

-A lot of Heroes: you get to play as Luke Skywalker, Boba Fett, Darth Vader, etc... There is almost a different hero for a different map.

-Fluent controls: the controls in this game are smooth and it feels good when you shoot a rebel scum in the face with your E-11.

-Space battles: The fact that this game had space battles where you can land on the other team’s ship and destroy it from the inside was ahead of its time and no other games captures space battles like this one. There are also different ships for different occasions like there is an x-wing for destroying regular enemies and y--wings to bomb their cruiser.

-A lot of maps: There is a bunch of maps in this game like Endor, Hoth, Geonosis, and much more.

-64 player battles: This is self explanatory

-Modable: If you pair this game with mods you can have an even better time with this game and if add all the user made maps with the ones in this game, there are over 800 maps for this game!!!

Cons:

-Aging: This game is 10 years old and there aren't too many people playing this game on Game Ranger. The graphics are out of date and sadly Pandemic studios went out of business in 2009.

That's about all the cons

Overall:
Star Wars Battlefront 2 is one of the greatest Star Wars games ever made and in my opinion, It is one of the greatest games ever made.

This game gets a 9/10. I highly recommend this game to any shooter fan and every Star Wars fan alike.

I hope you found this review helpful. Thanks for reading!!!

Game Ranger download for multiplayer: https://www.gameranger.com/

reviewText:
READ THIS REVIEW IF HESITANT ON BUYING THIS GAME!

I have been playing this game since it originally came out on ps2.I originally had this game on the PS2 (I still have it) and spent hundreds, if not thousands of hours on it. I got it 10 years ago the day it came out on PS2, now just got it on PC in the summer sale and still has to be the most fun and best game I ever played. I hope the new battlefront though is as good as this one, (2015) release date. The campaign is OK, not outstanding, but not bad. Though the campaign is roughly 6 hours long, Galactic Conquest is what most people will enjoy. This game is wonderful. The graphics are beautiful even to this day and the environments are very inspiring. Every Star Wars fan should check this one out. You can either do 1st or 3rd person shooting which is really nice and most shooter games don't give you that option, unfortunately. 3rd person is one its key characteristics and I hope Dice and EA implement it into the new game coming out along with the new movie. The difficulty of this game isn't really too bad at all, it only picks up in the last 3 or 4 missions. So frustrating, but again, it's amazing because I felt the struggles the Troopers felt going up against the rebel scum. It wasn't a walk in the park and the developers make you feel it. That's something I personally don't get from games like Halo or CoD. Though I have nothing against these games) If you are a fan of the way those shooters work, you will definitely enjoy this. Very well done and it's very compelling really. If you like Rogue Squadron, then you will like the way these ships fly, to say the least. This game is just a blast for any Star Wars fans, or FPS fans in general. It has a very nice story if you are a fan of Star Wars or just want to get deeper into the universe. I just really enjoy this game and truly can't find a downside unless a story line is a big deal to you. I was never really disappointed with this game, the Campaign was very enjoyable (and a bit challenging at times) but a little short and the maps are very fun to play on and has huge variety (From the snowy landscape of Hoth to the murky Swaps of Dagobah).This game is one of the best games I have ever played and the multiplayer is my favorite part which by the way is still there. I don't know why people are complaining about the online multiplayer, yes it was run by GAMESPY, and yes they did shutdown; but there is still DEDICATED SERVERS that you can go and play on if you want multiplayer action, and you can still HOST games and have friends join your server; you can also use Gameranger and join through there as well. The space combat is just how I remembered it fun and very unique in there being different ways to approach and destroy your opponent's ship. This game is a masterpiece of its time and deserves to be in your game library. (Hopefully with hours played on it :)
I give it a 10/10 for being one of the best and really only good Star wars game out there.

reviewText:
Star Wars Battlefront II was a full scale galactic conflict that only a Jedi could master.It was also the first game I actually played online. It was the PS2 version, and I remember being blown away by what you could do in the game. Flying Tie fighters, riding a Tauntaun, delivery the force choke to lightsaber insta-kill with Darth Vader on Mos Eisley, and of course Hoth on conquest. If it was in the movies, you could do it in this game. What made this game so awesome was that every player could find a class, or role that worked for them. Everyone working towards the same goal of capturing the command posts. Support roles were important, not everyone had to be an all star FPS player to help the team. Well it's been 10 years, how has the game aged? Gamespy is no more, and playing online now requires VPN, or a third party solution for games over the internet. But this game still rocks the LAN party. The specs to run SWBF2 are so minimal it can run on almost any PC (not your grandmas Windows 95, but anything from 2010 and up should be fine). Its just as fun as it was back then, and even appeals to the younger audience as well. My son who is 7 will ask to play this more than any other game in our Steam library. The game also supports full controller. It's listed as partial controller support by Steam, but I was able to map all the functions I needed to play without using a keyboard or Xpadder. With the release of SWBF3 I have to admit I'm disappointed to hear the class system is gone, space battles are gone, the campaign is gone, and the only way to play with another human being is to use an EA server. So again did SWBF2 age well? The answer is yes, and one thing is certain. Long after EA kills the servers for SWBF3, you'll still find a dedicated group playing SWBF2  online.

reviewText:
Star Wars Battlefront II is a shooter game from LucasArts, the Star Wars games publisher. It is a sequel to the previous game Star Wars Battlefront. In my opinion, the best Star Wars shooter game yet.

Star Wars Battlefront II, almost similar to the previous game, share a similar game mechanic but with more improvement and many new features, such as the new space battle with Star Destroyer or Mon Calamari cruiser as a base and target. The campaign of Star Wars Battlefront II follows the story of the 501st Legion from the Rise of the Empire era into the beginning of Galactic Civil War era, jumping you into many planetary and space battles.

Star Wars Battlefront II graphics has made quite improvement over the previous game, it may looks old, but it's and old game. Performance of the game is good, but some technical issues seems to happen on newer system with Windows 7 and above.

Star Wars Battlefront II is a great sequel, the best Star Wars shooter game yet with many gameplay and features. I recommend this.

Rating 9/10

reviewText: Given the choice between a copy of Call of Duty Ghosts and 5 copies of this game, I'd pick 5 copies of this game. Really old game, one of the games I played on my original XBox and enjoyed for years (until Star Wars Battlefront I + II were both scratched into unusableness). They play well and give you the option of 3rd and 1st player. Playing Vanilla is fun, but nowhere near as much fun as with mods, particularly the Battlefront Extreme (pretty sure it's Extreme) mod which adds a ton of new maps, classes and vehicles for all factions. Setting up a private game is super easy, taking only a GameSpy account and a few minutes, and bam, you have a highly customizable private (or public) game with maps and classes from mods (or a vanilla game should you so desire). You can have an hour long fight, where you can fight over a thousand enemies (changable before you launch your singleplayer or multiplayer game), or a quick 4v4 skirmish with less than a hundred reinforcements for both sides. You can also have a dog fight in space, using a range of Interceptor class fighters to Dropships, you can knock out your advesary's vital ship components or land your boarding party in their hangar and wipe them out from the inside. Because it's such an old game, you shouldn't expect much in terms of visuals but for how old it is, it's pretty good. The low price is also awesome, being only at $10. It may just be the fond memories I have of this game and it's predecessor, but I'd give it a 8.5/10.

reviewText:
This game may be 9 years old but is still worth picking up! As of July 2014 Multi-player was removed from this title but the singleplayer still provides hours of entertainment. What Battlefront 2 lacks behind in graphics it makes up with stunning gameplay. There is a variety of singleplayer gamemodes such as Instant Action, Campaign Mode and Galactic Conquest. Galactic Conquest is by far my favourite with it being much like a Star Wars edition of risk in where you command your space fleet across the galaxy defeating your opponent in both space battles and invading or defending a planet from a wave of attacks. However the campaign of this game is very short, easy and not the most entertaining with it only being about 2 hours long at most.

One of the best features about game is the ability to control your factions heroes from Mace Windu to Han Solo to Darth Vader. You can help your teammates on the battlefield (Droids, Stormtroopers, Rebels etc.) defeat their enemy with the power of a lightsaber or a scoundrel like Han (Who shot first!)

The only bad thing about this game is the lack of multiplayer, the graphics of this game are not the greatest but the game is still perfectly playable and will still provide hours of entertainment.

In conclusion this game is worth the £6.99 (Time of Review Price) and any Star Wars fan should pick this game up!

reviewText:
You pay $10 for this and for that $10 you get:

- 18 Ground Maps
- 6 Space Maps ( In Instant action. Glactic Conquest gives 9 more)
- 7 Diffrent games modes including Space Battles / CTF and Jedi/Sith assault
- 3 Diffrent Ways to play the game. (Story, Galactic Conquest, Instant Action)
- A wide Variety of vehicles to drive.
- Clone wars AND Rebel V.S. Empire time period.
- Massive games with up to 64 players online + AI
- 8 Heros/ Villans to play (Give or take 1)

For the NEW Battlefront you pay $60 and get:

- 4 planets/maps
- No clone wars
- 3 Heros / Siths
- No story
- No galactic conquest
- 4-6 Game modes
- No offline multiplayer (The two trial game modes you get dosnt count.)
- A $50 Season Pass

The Moral of this review is Star Wars Battlefront is the worst game of 2015.

P.S. Buy Star Wars Battlefront 2.

reviewText: Star Wars is one of my favorite movies ever. The first time I played Star Wars Battlefront II I was amazed by everything it has to offer. The game offers various maps based mosty off the prequel movies, but their are still a few sequel maps to play on. The game allows the player to switch between the Clone Wars and the Galactic Rebelion for every map. Every map comes with the gamemode Conquest". Conquest is a game mode when both sides are fighting for command post to dominate the other side's  reinforcments. After the player has reached a certain amount of points
date: he or she can play was various characters in the movie like Obi-Wan and Darth Maul. Although
recommended: if you are playing with all NPC's the game is almost very easy and it won't take long before you reach a special character. Luckily Star Wars Battlefront II adds multiplayer and a ton of server to join. Sadly the community isn't as big as it might have used to be. You'll still be able to find a server with a good amount of people though. I have played this game a lot of times with my friends online and we all enjoyed the experience. Another cool thing about the game is that also include space combat when two sides try to take down the other's defences. The graphics are now lacking to today's standards but it's still fits the atmosphere of Star Wars. If you are a fan of Star Wars

reviewText: Until Team Fortress 2 came out, this was my absolute favorite FPS.  After Team Fortress 2, and dabbling in many other shooter games, it's still solidly second despite being nearly ten years old.  Its age does make it difficult to recommend to people who are both not Star Wars fans or have not played the game before, but if you are a Star Wars fan or have fond memories of playing this game in the past, you should definitely pick it up without hesitation.  It's aged tremendously well, and until (or to those of us who have heard about it being canceled and restarted numerous times, unless) the new Battlefront comes out, there is no other game like it.\n\nOh, but before buying, you may want to make sure you have a good amount of friends to play alongside with, because multiplayer is where this game really shines (naturally).  And you especially want to make sure you have friends who are close by, since the online multiplayer's going down on May 31st, 2014.

reviewText:
This game really makes you feel like a guy on the battlefront.

There are a lot of maps from the Star Wars Comics and Films, with the ability to download other user created maps. These maps can be either huge or small with many turns, corridors, and corners, or big open fields, with vehicles and infantry squads battling to take control of the planet.

The space battles are epic! The fact that you can get into 5 types of starfighters from the movies, and shoot down the other enemy command ship is really fun. And you can also land inside the enemie's command ship to take out some of its critical components such as the engine cooler, life support system, and shields.

If you get a lot of points, the game will reward you by letting you play as a jedi. Jedis can use their lightsabers to slice through units and their force powers to crush them.

You can also switch from a 3rd person view to a 1st person view at any moment in the game to suit your style.

The game also offers a campaign mode, following the story of a trooper in Anakin Skywalker's squad, which tells you about the story from order 66, to between episodes III and IV, and after episode IV.

I really enjoyed this game and I recommend this fantastic game to any Star Wars fan, and any action fan. 9.5/10 if Star Wars fan, 9 or 8.5/10 if action fan. Enjoy!

reviewText:
My favorite star wars title, there is only one other Star Wars Game that I can say I like, but its because of its nostalgia (Jedi Power Battles PS1) but SWBF2 I remember playing back on PS2 and a short amount on the PSP, both of which were outstanding, especially when using multitap and playing with friends, being fairly new to steam, I was ecstatic to find out about the PC version of this game, and its just as fun and time rendering as I remember.

However, this review was centered around nostalgia and not gameplay quality, but for some reason, no other shooter I've played gives me the same experience as SWBF2, as I'm writing this review 12/26/13 SWBF2 was on sale for 50% off, and it was absolutely worth it, as is it full price, though I will have to agree with some past reviews, if you didnt play this game a long time ago, on the PC or PS2 or whatever, then theres a possibility you wont like it, its 8 years old, in the gaming world thats a damn long time, and the age of the game shows, but all of this goes back to the core question, is it fun? YES, if you see this game, and are THINKING about getting it, STOP, click BUY, and thank me later!! ... you wont be dissapointed.

Especially if you're a Star Wars fan, but, if your a Star Wars, and you dont have this game, theres something wrong with you.

reviewText:
This game is literally all I played when I was really, really small. Even if you're not into Star Wars - this game is really fun and recommended to play for family & friends. Although I didn't have this for Steam at the time, I soaked in thousands of hours in this game with It's modding capabilities.

Lol, and yeah - about the new Star Wars Battlefront by EA/DICE - Although their game looks well done, there are very serious flaws. This old gem actually offers a WHOLE LOT more than their game with the cost of moderate graphics and It's old gameplay.

Here in SWBFII, you have:

- The Clone Wars (Seriously guys, the Clones are better than Stormtroopers...)
- Space Battles
- 64 players, 32v32 - Including Multiplayer
- Playing as Wookies, Ewoks and other ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ inhabitants!
- Modding capabilities! That itself is like a HUGE ♥♥♥ DLC that will extend your game time with this old gem. All of it ranges from Space to Ground Battles to all the way to Zombies!
- TONS of Maps. With modding capabilities, that alone can crash your game due to It's massive content.

Sounds awesome, right? Well, let's take a look at EA's new Star Wars Battlefront. I mean, I'm not saying I won't play it, I definitely will - however It is a big letdown.

- 40 players only? You gotta be ♥♥♥♥ing kidding me.
- No Space Battles? Well, that's HALF of Star Wars sliced down already. If not, most.
- No Clone Wars either. What the ♥♥♥♥ guys? Seriously, Stormtroopers are ♥♥♥♥ING ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. So are the Rebels. If you pair a Clone against a Stormtrooper in a damn wrestle, I'd bet $30 the Clone would rip apart the Stormtrooper. Like, even the ♥♥♥♥ing Droids are better than them.

- Barely any maps. Like 5-6 only, and the only map that looks worth playing is Hoth. That's another slice of Star Wars cut down.
- Survival Mode... Oh my ♥♥♥♥ING GOD. If you two as Rebels manage to kill an entire ♥♥♥♥ing army of Imperials, it just makes them look even MORE pathetic than they actually are. Two or four people against an entire battalion of Stormtroopers and they would STILL lose.  LOL!

There's really only ONE good factor about this upcoming game.

- Beautiful graphics, amazing gameplay, lots of detail into literally everything.

Alright, time to stop nerding out, but all in all - this game is worth the $10 and even better on sale. The content is massive in this one.

reviewText:
SWB2 is an alright game, and I love it, but you will always want a little more from it. The game is from 2005, so there can only be so much, but what is there is amazing. The gameplay is good, the story is good, the level design is good. But there just isn't enough. Don't get me wrong, I highly recommend it, but there is not much to go off of. The thing that really makes the game, is mods, which the community loves, and therfore will hold your hand in installing them.

In the end, Star Wars Battlefront 2 is a great star wars game, and a good game. But get mods though, if you don't, the experience is going to get dry after about 8 or 9 hours.

Oh, and also, you can get multiplayer through 3rd party programs, I go with Game Ranger, great support. Don't worry though, you're not missing out on much if you don't play multiplayer, I never had much fun with it, and all the people who did played it to death, and they are really good. They'll rip out your ♥♥♥, suck on your hemroids like lolly pops, and trust me when I say this, not a pretty picture.

Good value for $10, and one of the best Star Wars games ever made, and the best with mods.

reviewText:
10 years ago...

This game had captured the majority of my childhood. First time I got my hands onto this game, almost everyday was powering on my PS2 just to play this classic either solo or with my bros. Massive land-based battles, space battles, hero mode, campaign, and galactic conquest ate up most of my free time. There was no doubt that this was the best Star Wars game ever made, and if not one of the best games I had ever played.

3 years ago...

A new Battlefront game for the next gen was officially announced. Finally! I could look forward to re-living my childhood, but with some new twists. As more gameplay trailers were released as time went on, my hype kept building up, awaiting to be satisfied on the day of release.

2 months ago...

I finally got my hands on the new Battlefront. I powered up my PS4 in excitement, hands held firmly on the controller, expecting to satisfy all the built up hype that was stored for 3 years, and entirely focused on what I expected to bring back happy memories. As I pressed start on the title screen, the first thing I was supposed to do was to create an EA account. After 5-10 minutes of restless anticipation, I finally started playing singleplayer. Indeed, I had quite a blast on singleplayer, but there was still loads of hype that needed to be satisfied. That's when I started playing all the modes on multiplayer. Overall, I had an enjoyable experience on this next gen Battlefront, but unfortunately, all the built up hype still wasn't quite satisfied. In fact, this EA remake of the beloved Battlefront I grew up with didn't live up to all the childhood memories that I had been expecting to re-live.

Today...

Since my good old PS2 had been out of commission for over 2 years, I decided to bring back my childhood (Which EA Battelfront failed to do) by downloading the original masterpiece from Steam. To this day, it still holds it's title as the best Star Wars game ever made.

I couldn't recommend this game enough to any Star Wars fan alike, let alone to any gamer in general. If you grew up with this game and are wanting to bring back pleasant memeories, put it in your Steam library now! If you still haven't played this masterpiece yet, please don't hesitate to give it a shot, especially while it's on sale.

reviewText:
Star Wars Battlefront II was a memorable experience during my childhood. From the year 2007 to present day, it continues to endure as one of my most memorable video game titles.

I had purchased it for the PS2 console, completed the well-written campaign, tinkered with galactic conquest, and enjoyed some multi-player a day after release. Subsequently, I had later discovered the instant action mode and its legendary unlocks.

I remember that invincibility cheat code to this day.
Up Up Up, Left, Down Down Down, Left, Up Up Up, Left, Right.

reviewText:
This may have been the original battlefield.

This follows an over the shoulder FPS type of game where you move towards an objective to complete it. Sounds simple right? Along the way your enemies be it online or in campaign have their own infantry moving towards you, vehicles of all sorts (I'm not a Star Wars fan so forgive me here), and a walker (?) thing you can jettison. I honestly love the depth of being able to fight on a planet or in the orbit of a planet.

I'm not a 100% what the heck is going on in the story as I've never watched Star Wars but hey, as a first timer playing the game I can get into it.

If you are able to get through the out-dated graphics you're in for a hell of a game. .... oh and one more thing to add a bit of complication to your life. This game does have controller support however you will spend some time key-binding everything manually. The joys of life... I know :).

Seriously though if this game is on sale I highly recommend buying it or some storm trooper will smack the yellow off your teeth. This game back in its hey day would have easily gotten an 8/10... but due to it's age :

7/10



********IMPORTANT***********

You may have trouble saving this game. In-game, go to options>audio>mixer>disabled .... it is a pull down menu. It may cause the game to crash and throw you back to the desktop. This has known to work for many systems. I did my research :)!

reviewText: Battlefront II is an absolute essential for any Star Wars fan, and it's been regarded many times as the best third person shooter ever made.  It stands up tall alongside popular series like CoD and Battlefield, and provides a similar experience fine-tuned to anyone who loves glowstick swords and laser beam guns.  The atmosphere is great and nothing captures the feeling of playing a Jedi or a Stormtrooper on the battlefield better.  The vanilla game has plenty of content, but what really makes this title shine is the rich tapestry of mods and extra user-created maps that have been contributed over the past nine years.  That said, it's absolutely necessary to play the game with the Conversion Pack and Battlefront Extreme if you want the best experience possible.  There are also a bunch of great maps and mods to be found in the Community Hub here on Steam as well as on Filefront, so it's worth a look if you find something you like.\n\nDon't get too excited yet though, while it's a great game, I can tell you it hasn't aged amazingly.  The classes are noticeably unbalanced and there are glaring glitches present(one involving the infamous issue of the game crashing when Stereo Mix isn't enabled).  The servers aren't densely populated anymore and there are usually only one or two with around 40 players.  Despite minor problems and showing age, the game is still very much worth the $10, even if you only play quick matches on Instant Action.

reviewText: I picked this game up for full price years back for the playstation 2 when online gaming over consoles was really hard to do, and was rare to take part in.  I played this game so much the disk wore out, just like I did the first one, and if you liked that then this is a no brainer.  It works as it should for keyboard and mouse, but also supports controllers, but you'll need to program each and every class individually, long setup, but worth it, though you'll still have to use the mouse during class selection, and the keyboard to talk.  A third person shooter at heart, the first person was added exclusively for pc gaming at  one point, so if you're worried it hasn't aged well, don't.  Allthough it ain't the prettiest thing out there, it's still got a decent player base and most of the models and textures are more than tolerable.  First person isn't bad either, though it does look quite a bit more dated than the third person models, it gets the job done, and it's still better than system shock 2's original fps models, no worries there. Allthough there's a lot of complaints of allied and enemy A.I. you mostly won't notice it at all because you'll be dying and killing so much.  You'll have the odd glaringly bad A.I. every so often, but you won't mind it at all if you decide to hit the multiplayer servers!  If you like third person shooters, first person shooters, online multiplayer, varied maps, engaging (albiet repetitive in long doses),  and starwars, this game is for you.   In fact if any of those reasons by themselves should merit a purchase, especially at the low price of 5.00$ it winds up being during most sales, and with the NEW starwars battlefront coming later next year, you'll be wanting to hone your skills again.  So pick up your blaster, polish your best suit of white armor, and strap in, it's gonna be a fun ride through the past.

reviewText:
Get ready for nostalgia, and a lot of it.

I first played this game as a kid at a couple different friend's houses and fell in love with the game.

STORYLINE

You are a member of the 501st at the Battle of Geinosis. From there you are given different missions that start in the Clone Wars. Order 66 is given and you witness the fall of the Republic and the rise of the Empire and then the fall of the Empire. all of this while still a member of the 501st. The missions are straight forward and objectives are given one right after the other. Some are easier than others but over all, not bad. The only thing I would have changed is some of the space missions, but space missions are optional. Overall 9/10

GRAPHICS AND THINGS OF THE LIKENESS

Gameplay is pretty smooth. I personally never had any issues, but that may be because of my pc. My pc isn't the best but it runs pretty good for me. No lag, fast loading. I have no complaints. Graphics wise, it's not that bad for a 10 year old game. It has that old game feel that makes you nostalgic. A somewhat blocky appearence to the maps but thats to be expected. The characters look very smooth for their time, not extremely blocky but not completely smooth, but like I said; Smooth for their time. Overall 9/10

REPLAY VALUE

There are a few different game modes that I'm going to mention. First, and my personal favorite, Galactic Conquest. This is a turn based mode. You can play as any of the sides in the Clone Wars and the Galactic Civil War. You take turns moving your fleet across a small galaxy, conquering the galaxy. You win when you have control of all star systems and elliminated all enemy fleets. This mode can be played 4 times before you start repeating. It's completely random which adds more to the fun. the only thing I don't like about this mode is the number of troops that you have in a fleet. 150 points to win on land and you need to score 180 points in space. The number of points you get for completeing objectives" is a lot for the win point to be 150 or 180. So for that I give 7/10.
The other mode is Instant Action. Pretty straight forward. you can make your own map list and when you hit launch
date: it goes through all the maps in your list. It also allows you to edit some settings like the number of points you need to win
recommended: number of troops on land battles
hoursPlayed: how often special characters show up
voteText: and more. This is where I have the most fun because I can make a map list that will be exactly how I want it. Only complaint is you can't play both Clone Wars and Galactic Civil War on all maps. Some maps are exclusive to one era. for that 8/10. Overall for replay value I would give 8/10"

reviewText:
Get ready for nostalgia, and a lot of it.

I first played this game as a kid at a couple different friend's houses and fell in love with the game.

STORYLINE

You are a member of the 501st at the Battle of Geinosis. From there you are given different missions that start in the Clone Wars. Order 66 is given and you witness the fall of the Republic and the rise of the Empire and then the fall of the Empire. all of this while still a member of the 501st. The missions are straight forward and objectives are given one right after the other. Some are easier than others but over all, not bad. The only thing I would have changed is some of the space missions, but space missions are optional. Overall 9/10

GRAPHICS AND THINGS OF THE LIKENESS

Gameplay is pretty smooth. I personally never had any issues, but that may be because of my pc. My pc isn't the best but it runs pretty good for me. No lag, fast loading. I have no complaints. Graphics wise, it's not that bad for a 10 year old game. It has that old game feel that makes you nostalgic. A somewhat blocky appearence to the maps but thats to be expected. The characters look very smooth for their time, not extremely blocky but not completely smooth, but like I said; Smooth for their time. Overall 9/10

REPLAY VALUE

There are a few different game modes that I'm going to mention. First, and my personal favorite, Galactic Conquest. This is a turn based mode. You can play as any of the sides in the Clone Wars and the Galactic Civil War. You take turns moving your fleet across a small galaxy, conquering the galaxy. You win when you have control of all star systems and elliminated all enemy fleets. This mode can be played 4 times before you start repeating. It's completely random which adds more to the fun. the only thing I don't like about this mode is the number of troops that you have in a fleet. 150 points to win on land and you need to score 180 points in space. The number of points you get for completeing objectives" is a lot for the win point to be 150 or 180. So for that I give 7/10.
The other mode is Instant Action. Pretty straight forward. you can make your own map list and when you hit launch
date: it goes through all the maps in your list. It also allows you to edit some settings like the number of points you need to win
recommended: number of troops on land battles
hoursPlayed: how often special characters show up
voteText: and more. This is where I have the most fun because I can make a map list that will be exactly how I want it. Only complaint is you can't play both Clone Wars and Galactic Civil War on all maps. Some maps are exclusive to one era. for that 8/10. Overall for replay value I would give 8/10"

you can simple play a sequence of matches against NPC's set to regular or elite difficulty (I generally just played offline matches against npc's).

reviewText: Battlefront 2 is a great tactical 1st/3rd person shooter. Similar to the original, the objective is to capture command posts and eliminate the enemy. The space battles are impressive and there is a decent selection of ships to choose from. Like most Star Wars games the music and sound fx are brilliant, the graphics are still impressive despite being released 10 years ago. You can choose from four classes including infantry and sniper, including special hero characters like Luke,Vadar, Windu etc. One of the best maps is Hoth, where you can defend the base against the galactic empire and use snowspeeders to take down AT-AT's. Overall a great tactical game with new maps and options that rivals the original. 84%

reviewText: Literally the best game you could ever buy, I dont understand why this isnt the best seller on Steam every week. People need to get this game before it goes back up to its original price of £49.99, the game has no flaws and I am unable to find even one thing wrong with it, I am still shocked by the fact that this game hasnt won every gaming award out there. The graphics are easily 10/10, Battlefield and Crysis on the highest graphics have nothing on this beast. The sound is something out of this planet, the beautifully orchestrated music and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ic sound effects are truely amazing 10/10. The final and greatest thing about this game is the fact that the voice acting is truly in a league of its own, all voices are perfectly alligned with the characters lips and the original voice actors are all used for there characters. Truly a perfect and pure game, if you dont own such a masterpiece then you are easily brain dead or inbred.

reviewText: ...a game, where mines can be planted on moving vehicles. A game, where slamming an Airspeeder into the side of an AT-AT is more viable than harpooning its legs. A game, where merely standing on an Airspeeder inexplicably violates Newton's 3rd Law. A game, where all enemies 100+ meters away from you moonwalk in a circle. Star Wars Battlefront 2 has defied any and all explanations -- and yet, defined my years as a formative gamer. It was my pleasure to have played this horribly bugged and seldom-patched game in its prime.

reviewText: One of the greatest PS2 games of all time. Sure the servers were shut down about 3 weeks ago, but gamemaster allows you to play it online anyway so it's all good xD Almost all players are helpful, and the game features  many different modes including space battles! With up to 124 people per team on Hoth,Genosis and Kashyyk the game is amust buy. The modding community if amazing with different maps, skins, classes and total conversion mods!  The vanilla game features a wide array of maps from the star wars movies and 6 different classes per team. People can also play as their favouroite heroes and villains from the movies like Anakin, Chewbacca, Darth Vader and General Griveous. The game is amazing and is worth every penny due to the massive battles and vehicles. 10/10

reviewText:
What can I say about Battlefront? This game was a part of my childhood, and even if it wasn't, even if i wasn't a huge Star Wars nerd, I'd still love this classic game.

It comes with memorable maps, great gamemodes, and a very enjoyable game overall.

If any of you are Star Wars fans, or even just fans of the class based shooter, this game is a must have.


UPDATE: I've got a LOT more to say about this game.

The game types are absolutely fantastic. They have Multiplayer, which is self explanatory, yet still awesome. They have Galactic Conquest, a single-player conquest game in which you try to conquer star systems on memorable planets such as Kamino and Kashyyyk.

The maps are memorable and immersive as hell. Especially the space maps. They have many different maps such as Geonosis, Mustufar, Mygeeto, Yavin 4, and even the Death Star and Mos Eisely, Tatooine.

My god, I'd like to say more about this amazing game, but it's almost midnight where I am and I'm tired.

I absolutely love this game and if you decide to buy it (WHICH YOU SHOULD), I hope you love it too!

reviewText:
Star Wars Battlefront is single handedly one of THE best games I have ever played to this date.

~Do not allow the price tag to deter you from purchasing the game. Definitely worth the amount you pay for this game.
~This game is endless amounts of fun, even 9 years in the making and I am still satisfied upon playing this game for the first time in so long.
~I feel this game has perfected gameplay of first person shooters and to the point in which I would rather play this game over a mass amount of modern titles.

-Rating: 9/10. Hilarious, fun, engaging game. Perfected the 1st person shooter" feel and still continues to evoke mass amounts of nostalgia even playing it now.

After getting this game to work properly for my windows 8 system.

The one issue i have with this game is one-sided the AI is. It's either strong or weak. there is no balance, especailly the Jedi during Story Mission Knightfall"

I will recommend this game for star wars fans and any gamer in general.

There is no multiplayer

reviewText:
I was very worried that my childhood memory was playing with me as I was trying to remember how good this game was, but when I booted it up and made a play list of my favorite maps (according to my memory) and when I got in, it was the most amazing feeling I have ever had as I felt like a child again. The moment of WTF was in Hoth with 128 bots on each team and me on a hill watching the carnage and destruction of the battlefield will stick into my memory forever.

If you are a big Star Wars fan or you like huge battles, get this god dam game because you will not regret it. I promise!

10/10

reviewText:
This game is amazing. I'll leave it as that.
Pros:
-The textures and models aged beautifully, and hold up well to this day, even rivialling the 2015 remake.
-The campaign and Galactic Conquest are always fun, and propose a brand new layer of depth to the game.
-No DLC ♥♥♥♥.
-Controls are responsive, and make you feel like you're actually in the movie.
Cons:
-Some of the faces look off, but this is a minor complaint, since they still look good and this was 2005 standards.
-Lock on doesn't really lock on the target.
-Space controls are really strange compared to console. This is once again a minor complaint, since controls can be changed, and plugging in an X-Box or Steam controller can fix this.

Overview: The game is beautiful, vehicle combat is amazing, and a vast amount of heroes and maps make this game from ten years ago better than the one we have today. This game is a definite buy. If there's a sale, snag this game, because it's perfect for any Star Wars fan.  Rating: 9.5/10

reviewText:
10/10
This is the epitome of Star Wars inside a video game. Battlefront II builds upon the already successful and fun capture-the-point aspect of battlefront I but adds an element of chaos with the addition of new vehicles, soldier type, and Jedi. The standard team versus team battles are fun and engaging. It is perfectly timed to let you have fun and explore new ways of winning but does not make the game feel tedious. Jedi versus Jedi mode offers new fun to the classic capture-the-point game type. The extra speed and abilities of Jedi's makes this game mode fast pace and exciting. With the ability to sprint at super speed, jump to higher length, and duel other players, Jedi versus Jedi mode is one of the most addicting and fun game types there is. Not to mention the space battles, which are very well done. The games offers enough control to the player where one needs to slow down, aim, and shoot to destroy the opponent's battle cruiser but leaves enough freedom where the players can achieve victory through different means. Overall, this game is a classic of the PS2 era and I would recommend everyone who likes a casual, action packed game.

May the force be with you

reviewText:
So, Star Wars: Battlefront II is now a decade old.  Is it worth $10?  Yeah, I'd say so.  The graphics look good for 10 years ago.  The gameplay itself is fairly arcadey and simplistic (there are no unlocks, really), but the maps are fun to play.  On the whole, I find it to be an enjoyable casual shooter for offline play, particularly in the Galactic Conquest mode.

Also of note, here are things this ten-year-old version of Battlefront has that the new EA/DICE version does not:

- A $10 price tag (less if you get it on sale).
- An actual space mode, which also lets you attempt to board and sabotage the enemy capital ship.
- Vehicles that let more than one player ride in them.
- Spawn points that you can select, instead of randomly appearing on the battlefield.
- More maps per game mode.
- Clone Wars Era troopers and maps.
- Soldier classes with different specific abilities.
- Single-player offline mode against (admittedly rather dim) bots, where you can play pretty much the full version of the game.
- A dedicated single-player campaign (although, really, it's just the same maps from multiplayer, with you playing as a member of the 501st with the odd cutscene here and there).

So, yeah, I'd say this is well worth your money if you just want a casual shoot-em-up to screw around with here and there.  Is it an amazing game to stand the test of time and be lauded for generations to come?  Nah, not really.  It's fun, but it's simple.  On the other hand, that's kind of the appeal.

reviewText:
Nostalgic is the feeling that you should get when playing this fantastic game. This is the squeal to the famed and fantastic game, Star Wars Battlefront (1). The campaign takes place in the mid-late Clone Wars era. You play as a battle-hardened soldier from the 501st legion (aka Vader's Fist) lead by Jedi Knight/General Anakin Skywalker. The campaign takes you through multiple planets and systems such as: Mygeeto, Kashyyyk,  Felucia, Utapau, Kamino, Hoth, The Death Star and many other planets/battle grounds. Not only can you play as Clone Troopers, Droids, Rebels and Storm Troopers, but you can also play as many different Jedi and Sith. Gameplay wise, you are able to play as 6 Different Classes. These include: Normal Infantry, Heavy, Scout, Engineer, Special class 1, Special class 2 and Jedi/Sith (You will need to unlock these characters through points earned during the battle).

Did I mention you can also use and command a variety of different vehicles? From small AT-RT's to Gigantic AT-AT's, these are only some of the MANY different vehicles that are able to be used. Having multiple tanks on your side can mean a swift victory for you and your team. But what if you are going against them? Well, mines and rockets are always available for your use in demolitions. In this Battlefront, you are also able to participate in space battles. They too, are fantastic and fun to play.

Multiplayer wise, the Game Spy severs for this game have been shut down. Although, don't give up your hope. Third Party hosts such as Game Ranger allow you to host and join servers set up by other people. This can still supply you and your friends with the nostalgia received from this amazing game. Here is the Game Ranger site: http://www.gameranger.com

Even the best games have a few little flaws here and there. A few things I think that should've been included in this game  can include more squad commands. In the previous Battlefront, there were 4 commands. They include; 'Follow Me', 'Move out', 'Hold Position' and 'At Ease'. These squad commands can prove to be extremely helpful for strategically capturing command posts and ultimately, winning battles. It also would've been good if they added commands for star fighters. For example, if you pressed the 'Follow Me' key, the fighter you were looking at would start following you and so on.

All in all, this game is very fun, balanced and extremely enjoyable for both Star Wars and Non-Star Wars fans alike. I can't wait for the next Battlefront game. If you do at any time, get bored of the same maps, you can always download mods from the Battlefront community. They can supply you and your friends with an endless amount of fun! I'll give this game a 10/10, it's absolutely fabulous! If you are a Star Wars fan and haven't got it yet, buy it immediately!

reviewText:
Positives:

This and Battlefront 1 are two of the main reasons I still own my original Xbox.

The ground battles are amazingly easy to learn and play as well as ridiculously fun to get killing spreas on, they feel more like actual battles then any other game I've played (including the Battlefield series). The space battles are fun but hard as well just being beautiful even with out dated graphics and they feel like a genuine space simulator and not a stupid rail shooter.

Last but not least; the Jedi battles. Never in my life have I had this much fun with a lightsaber; not as a kid with toy, not as a teen with other Star Wars games and not with any other sword battle game; EVER! Whether you're in a normal ground battle literally ripping though squad after squad of droids or in the Heroes Vs Villians mode on Mos Eisley. It is in everyway the just stupid, dumb, amazing fun!

Negatives:

There are only a couple reasons why this game is not as amazing (and perfect) as it's predicessor; one is the squad commands being missing for no reason and the other is the maps are not nearly as good as the original.

Final verdict:

9.5/10 Amazing game, why have you not bought it yet?

reviewText:
Nostalgic is the feeling that you should get when playing this fantastic game. This is the squeal to the famed and fantastic game, Star Wars Battlefront (1). The campaign takes place in the mid-late Clone Wars era. You play as a battle-hardened soldier from the 501st legion (aka Vader's Fist) lead by Jedi Knight/General Anakin Skywalker. The campaign takes you through multiple planets and systems such as: Mygeeto, Kashyyyk,  Felucia, Utapau, Kamino, Hoth, The Death Star and many other planets/battle grounds. Not only can you play as Clone Troopers, Droids, Rebels and Storm Troopers, but you can also play as many different Jedi and Sith. Gameplay wise, you are able to play as 6 Different Classes. These include: Normal Infantry, Heavy, Scout, Engineer, Special class 1, Special class 2 and Jedi/Sith (You will need to unlock these characters through points earned during the battle).

Did I mention you can also use and command a variety of different vehicles? From small AT-RT's to Gigantic AT-AT's, these are only some of the MANY different vehicles that are able to be used. Having multiple tanks on your side can mean a swift victory for you and your team. But what if you are going against them? Well, mines and rockets are always available for your use in demolitions. In this Battlefront, you are also able to participate in space battles. They too, are fantastic and fun to play.

Multiplayer wise, the Game Spy severs for this game have been shut down. Although, don't give up your hope. Third Party hosts such as Game Ranger allow you to host and join servers set up by other people. This can still supply you and your friends with the nostalgia received from this amazing game. Here is the Game Ranger site: http://www.gameranger.com

Even the best games have a few little flaws here and there. A few things I think that should've been included in this game  can include more squad commands. In the previous Battlefront, there were 4 commands. They include; 'Follow Me', 'Move out', 'Hold Position' and 'At Ease'. These squad commands can prove to be extremely helpful for strategically capturing command posts and ultimately, winning battles. It also would've been good if they added commands for star fighters. For example, if you pressed the 'Follow Me' key, the fighter you were looking at would start following you and so on.

All in all, this game is very fun, balanced and extremely enjoyable for both Star Wars and Non-Star Wars fans alike. I can't wait for the next Battlefront game. If you do at any time, get bored of the same maps, you can always download mods from the Battlefront community. They can supply you and your friends with an endless amount of fun! I'll give this game a 10/10, it's absolutely fabulous! If you are a Star Wars fan and haven't got it yet, buy it immediately!

reviewText:
Since the new Battlefront game came out a month ago, I felt like it was absolutely necessary to rework my review. I've been playing this game since I first got my PS2, and for Nostalgia's sake, I bought it again for the PC. I must say that I didn't regret buying it again for another system because I feel like the price was worth it when I first bought it(Around 5 bucks like 2 years ago).

Even though it's 10 years old now, the game still holds up as possibly one of the best Star Wars games to have ever been made. It has a variety of locations for maps, and allowed for single player action which spanned out into either Galactic Conquest, Campaign Mode, and Instant Action. While the graphics are certainly dated, the game is so much fun to play through due to how you were really thrust into the Star Wars Universe and felt like you were just an average soldier on some sort of galactic battlefield.

Another thing this game has going for it are the mods and community created maps. While Filefront is down, you can still find a large amount of maps made by the community and mods that vastly improve the game and make it look much better than it originally was. While I would say that the game survived so long was due to nostalgia, I'd have to say it's because of the mods. The amount of side mods(Republic v. CIS, Empire v. Rebels, etc.) and interesting maps made by the modding and mapping community just give you an infinite amount of possibilities with what you can do in Star Wars Battlefront II.

I don't think any Star Wars game has had the virtue of having so many community made things for it to explore and try out like SWBII. Along with that, the fun gameplay, and nostalgia, this game is definitely worth the buy.

reviewText:
This game came out during a really great time for Star Wars games.  It was surrounded by Jedi Outcast, Jedi Academy, Battlefront 1, Empire at War, Revenge of the Sith video game, The Sith Lords (KotOR2), Republic Commando, Star Wars Galaxies Total Experience, Clone Campaigns, etc.  And unfortunately, after 2006 there were very little Star Wars games that were any good.  So this game, to me, is considered one of the great ones of the pinacle of Star Wars gaming.

The classes are well balanced.  The special troops have very different styles of play, but are not op.  The Clone Commander might have a machien gun with unlimited bullets, but it has no grenades, and is good only for close up troop destruction.  The droideka is pretty awesome, but it has a completely different playstyle as well.

You have to get quite a bit of shots off the kill someone.  Even vehicles cannot one shot you.  The only one shots in the game are lightsabers and the sniper rifle head shots.  As it gets harder it definitely does get harder.  Space combat takes a bit fo a learning curve at first, but in one or two space combats you will be able to learn the gist of it.

I would say the only major downfall is the AI.  They can literally hurt your game.  In one mission (the mission I always have trouble with) you have to defend the Jedi library from being destroyed by the Jedi (they don't want the Empire to get the knowledge within it).  With a close up shotgun to the head, you can kill them in two shots.  Otherwise, otherwise they take 2-3 shots to take down.  The AI would face off against a Jedi, shoot it once, and then run out of the room to some other place.  Seriously, the AI will force me to quit in anger.  Even the opposing AI is somewhat stupid.  But the online play fixes that.

So out of all the game, the only detracting qualities are the sometimes pathetic AI and the (expected) learning curve for the space combat.  Otherwise, this game is a mighty good farewell to a great generation of Star Wars gamers and games in general.

reviewText:
Star Wars: Battlefront II is no standard sandbox shooter; it creates a feel of huge cinematic battles, without forcing plays to take the game all too seriously and allow them to play the game tactically or freely.

Players can select which map they wish to fight on. All the classics of each chapter of the Star Wars series are included, Hoth, Kamino, Jabba’s Pallace, Mustafar, there are a total of 18 different land maps and 6 specific space maps, most of these can be played on both the first and second trilogy.

Battlefront II offers a variety of different game modes for the player to choose. Mainly there is the Conquest mode, and the Assault mode. In Conquest, the object is for players to capture all opposing bases, disallowing enemy troops to enter the field, or to simply keep shooting the enemy until their remaining troop spawns run out. Pending on which bases are controlled by either team, a huge strategic advantage can be seized.

Then there is the Assault mode, which is the space battle mode. Players must destroy parts of the enemy mother ship (which is where players spawn from). This includes destroying enemy engines, life support systems, auto turrets, command bridges, etc. Not all of this offers an immediate advantage other than the points, which is still extremely useful as the moment the enemy team reaches the set limit of points (damage to their ship, or loss of fighter planes), they lose.  The area which the player is allowed to roam is massive. The lock on missile and blaster system works a treat and is still on par with new air combat based games. Assault also offers the ability for players to infiltrate the enemy ship, allowing an inside job on destroying certain parts of it!

There is also the Hunt mode, where players must wipe out the native species of the specified map, or must survive playing as it. Then there is Capture the Flag, which is your standard CTF mode where players must carry the flag back to their own base.

The infantry fighting in the game is good, as well as the vehicle combat found in land maps. There is both a first person and third person views, both can be used affectively and don’t hinder combat in any noticeable way. The infantry class system is relatively standard but works. There is your Assault, Heavy, Sniper, and Engineer classes. Then there is two unlockable classes for each individual team, which are unlocked once the player reaches the set amount of points. Each class is balanced well with the pros and cons, teamwork and strategy is paramount to victory.

Star Wars: Battlefront II is one of the best Star Wars games and Sandbox shooters in my opinion. It holds its ground against those high budget new releases of both the Star Wars and Sandbox Shooter genre.
